Key Match Events: Nurul Hasan took the ball prior to it passing the stumps and whipped off the bails in excitement, but a no ball was called due to the wicket-keeper's position.
The no ball call led to an extra run being added to Zimbabwe's score and four runs required for victory, and the batting side was given a free hit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a thrilling final over victory for Bangladesh in their ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022 clash against Zimbabwe.
The ICC Playing Conditions and MCC Laws were referenced to explain the no ball call and its consequences.
Others: Law 27.3.1 states that the wicket-keeper shall remain wholly behind the wicket at the striker's end from the moment the ball comes into play until a ball delivered by the bowler touches the bat or person of the striker or passes the wicket at the striker's end or the striker attempts a run.
Law 27.3.2 states that in the event of the wicket-keeper contravening this Law, the striker's end umpire shall call and signal No ball as soon as applicable after the delivery of the ball.
